 <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עָגוּר‎</span> **noun [masculine]** apparently understood by Masoretes as name of a bird; very uncertain; ==crane== according to [[BDB#Saad|Saad]] (Isaiah), but note of crane not suitable ([[BDB#Tristr|Tristr]]<sup>NHB 239 f.</sup>); — <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְתוֺר וְסוּס וְעָגוּר‎</span> [[Jer.8.7|Jer 8:7]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כְּסוּס עָגוּר‎</span> [[Isa.38.14|Isa 38:14]] (but here gloss [[BDB#Klo|Klo]] [[BDB#Brd|Brd]] [[BDB#Di|Di]] Dn [[BDB#Che|Che]]<sup>Hpt</sup>); [[BDB#Thes|Thes]] and (in Jeremiah) [[BDB#Hi|Hi]] [[BDB#Gf|Gf]] [[BDB#Gie|Gie]] strike out <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְ‎</span> and take <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ע‎</span> as adjective of <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סוס‎</span> = ***twittering*** or the like; [[BDB#Thes|Thes]] assumes transpos. from <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎גער‎</span>, Ethiopic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***cry***. I, II, III. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד‎</span> see I.  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עדה‎</span>. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עֵד‎</span> see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עוד‎</span>. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עֹד‎</span> see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עוֺד‎</span>. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עִדֹּא‎</span> see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עדד‎</span>. below,
